H0.text: what type of economy exists in china. Mixed Economy

H1.text: what type of economy exists in china. Command Economy

H2.text: what type of economy exists in china. Market Economy

H3.text: what type of economy exists in china. Socialist state

A4.text: The People's Republic of China has a developing mixed socialist market economy, incorporating industrial policies and strategic five-year plans.

A5.text: China engages in state-led investment and industrial policy and with a significant state-owned enterprise sector.

A6.text: In 2015, Curtis J. Milhaupt and Wentong Zheng classified China's economic system as state capitalism because the state directs and guides all major aspects of the Chinese economy—including both the state and private sectors—while not collecting dividends from the ownership of its enterprises.

A7.text: Du and Xu concluded that China is not a market socialist economy, but an unstable form of capitalism.
